author: Hugo Ojeda
title: ADA human resources
description: job applicants want to improve their resume or if they don't, they want to make a resume to improve their job offer opportunities.

assessments.note: I have no idea why this should be based on a blockchain and how this application would be a good flagship for Cardano.

The proposal presents an idea / draft of a platform for creating resumes, but it is not clear what the purpose of a dapp (instead of an app) and the need to use blockchain on that platform. In order to be able to understand if the proposal addresses the challenge, it is necessary to understand what type of use the platform will have in the blockchain.
I do not think that this proposal effectively addresses any part of the challenge - it seems to be still in the concept stage.
It's a nice idea, to be sure, but has too many variables that are not accounted for to be implemented at this time.

Provide more information to convince the voters that there is an advantage to have this service using blockchain. How can this proposed application handle the different CV requirements needed to be tailored to each of the different job types around the world? Maybe start with a small scope and define it in the proposal.

There is very little depth in terms of how much this idea is worked through. It is a peculiar use case but would have loved to learn/understand more of what authors are planning to do with it in general. There isn't really any attempt presently to tie the proposal into how it all fits within greater goals of Cardano. Knowing that would also help understand impact it could have once launched and benefits drawing out of it for the community. Needs more work to be able to present it as investable proposal.
The idea could be expanded to applying these resumes to potential employers, creating a decentralised interim service.
Within Discord there are questions posed without follow-up and nothing included in this proposal either.
Software engineer is the only provided information. No plan provided.

The presented plan lacks details. There is not enough information to assess the proposer's qualifications. Without this information, it is not possible to assess the chances of successful implementation of the proposal.
The proposer does have an idea for a potential Dapp or integration, but the available in-depth information on experience and the lack of a plan are not confidence inspiring.
No team member with HR experience. No plan in place on how to seed a 2-way marketplace. Budget is too low to be done well.
There is no mention of resources with experience in HR and Recruitment who can provide requirements and advice to make this proposal work.

Given the lack of information provided - we are unable to determine experience levels, readiness with team/individuals to carry out proposal. Nor we have clear understanding what this particular budget/and how/ it plans to achieve what it sets out to do. This also happens because there really is a missing sensible plan that would tie it all together. I would suggest reworking proposal and adding more information so that community can examine it properly.

It leaves me with 2 massive questions:
1) What would happen if this idea gets widespread and everybody creates resumes in the same format? There would be no way to 'distinguish' oneself.
2) What about privacy risks? It concludes handing out personal information to strangers over the internet.
No relevant experience listed, only title. No follow up leads to impression that no follow up will happen.
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility of the proposal and how it will address the proposed challenge.
The proposal could benefit from providing much better information on feasibility, a detailed plan, milestones, a budget breakdown. It is not baked well enough.
Not enough information provided. The idea technically addresses the challenge, but is lacking any relevant context as to how it can be successfully implemented

As a suggestion, work with recruitment agencies and get feedback on what requirements the application should meet in order to become useful. With the requirements, lay out a solution which has a chance to attract applicants and reviewers. Provide a strong argument why using blockchain is an ideal solution. Create an initial scope or target market to develop and test out.

Due to being it a really barebone concept - there is lack of roadmap and milestone elements. We don't know how and when this can achieved. Nor is there any understanding appropriate metrics, KPI, challenges, risks. Things that would make it easier for community to understand how auditable this project is. How do we measure its success/progress or lack thereof. Adding these elements will help elevate proposal. But at the moment we can't consider it for funding as is.
The plan seems hastily written down and lacks crucial information: risk assessment, roadmap, funding detail, ROI.
There is no identified value returned to the community, and no indication of what KPI's matter.

solution: the applicant sends his resume to be reviewed and a human resources professional reviews it.
